in a way that only appears in a child if both parents supply the controlling gene (= the part of a cell that controls the physical development, behaviour, etc. of an individual plant or animal and is passed on from its parents): recessively inherited The haemoglobin disorders are a group of recessively inherited conditions of varying severity. It is a form of the eye disease that can be inherited either recessively or dominantly.
